intro: Myrtoleucodendron polygaloides, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant has lance-shaped leaves and produces capsules as its fruit, which contain numerous seeds. It thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to the unique climate of Hawaii. Myrtoleucodendron polygaloides plays an important role in the local ecosystem and is a symbol of Hawaiian cultural heritage.
